pr_title: PoC: Migrate CommonJS components to ES6

timeline.bodyText:
Now that we are on it, I wonder if with some good regex it is possible to:

find and replace all the "....." to '.....'
keep a space between brackets from {abc} to { abc }

while using imports. I see we are standardizing it so it would be nice, but not really required.
timeline.author: ncounter

replies.bodyText: And while we are at it maybe even standardize the number of spaces we use for indentation. Some files use 2 others 4. I don't mind either but we should stay consistant.
replies.author: parlt91

replies.bodyText:
This disturbs me as well 🤣
On the other hand, I prefer single quotes and {abc} without spaces, but I guess we can leave it to @Etheryte to decide
replies.author: cbbayburt

replies.bodyText: This caught my eye as well, but I didn't want to throw everything along with the kitchen sink into one PR. I'll create a follow-up card and do it there if that works for you?
replies.author: Etheryte

replies.bodyText:
If I could vote, I would:

2 space only, I think we already have it in place as a standardization, probably we don't have it enforced nor a checkstyle rule to blame who breaks it.
single quotes
no real preference for space or no-space on {abc}

Time for a strong check style test to fail if someone breaks them, whatever the rules will be? We do in Java, why not here?
replies.author: ncounter

replies.bodyText: I created SUSE/spacewalk#13437 to track this with a short summary of the above.
replies.author: Etheryte
